title: Hedmark (Storting constituency)
text:
Hedmark is one of the 19 <a href="multi-member">multi-member</a> <a href="constituency">constituencies</a> of the <a href="Storting">Storting</a>, the national <a href="legislature">legislature</a> of <a href="Norway">Norway</a>. The constituency was established in 1921 following the introduction of <a href="proportional%20representation">proportional representation</a> for elections to the Storting. It consists of the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Norway">municipalities</a> of <a href="Alvdal">Alvdal</a>, <a href="%C3%85mot">Åmot</a>, <a href="%C3%85snes">Åsnes</a>, <a href="Eidskog">Eidskog</a>, <a href="Elverum">Elverum</a>, <a href="Engerdal">Engerdal</a>, <a href="Folldal">Folldal</a>, <a href="Grue%2C%20Norway">Grue</a>, <a href="Hamar">Hamar</a>, <a href="Kongsvinger">Kongsvinger</a>, <a href="L%C3%B8ten">Løten</a>, <a href="Nord-Odal">Nord-Odal</a>, <a href="Os%2C%20Innlandet">Os</a>, <a href="Rendalen">Rendalen</a>, <a href="Ringsaker">Ringsaker</a>, <a href="S%C3%B8r-Odal">Sør-Odal</a>, <a href="Stange">Stange</a>, <a href="Stor-Elvdal">Stor-Elvdal</a>, <a href="Tolga%2C%20Norway">Tolga</a>, <a href="Trysil">Trysil</a>, <a href="Tynset">Tynset</a> and <a href="V%C3%A5ler%2C%20Innlandet">Våler</a> in the <a href="Counties%20of%20Norway">county</a> of <a href="Innlandet">Innlandet</a>. The constituency currently elects six of the 169 members of the Storting using the <a href="Open%20list">open</a> <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a> <a href="electoral%20system">electoral system</a>. At the <a href="2021%20Norwegian%20parliamentary%20election">2021 parliamentary election</a> it had 152,228 registered electors.
Electoral system.
Hedmark currently elects six of the 169 members of the Storting using the <a href="Open%20list">open</a> <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a> <a href="electoral%20system">electoral system</a>. Constituency seats are allocated by the County Electoral Committee using the <a href="Modified%20Sainte-Lagu%C3%AB%20method">Modified Sainte-Laguë method</a>. <a href="Compensatory%20seat">Compensatory seat</a>s (seats at large) are calculated based on the national vote and are allocated by the National Electoral Committee using the Modified Sainte-Laguë method at the constituency level (one for each constituency). Only parties that reach the 4% national <a href="Electoral%20threshold">threshold</a> compete for compensatory seats.
Election results.
Detailed.
2020s.
2021.
Results of the <a href="2021%20Norwegian%20parliamentary%20election">2021 parliamentary election</a> held on 13 September 2021:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Tor%20Andr%C3%A9%20Johnsen">Tor André Johnsen</a> (FrP); <a href="Emilie%20Enger%20Mehl">Emilie Enger Mehl</a> (Sp); <a href="Anna%20Molberg">Anna Molberg</a> (H); <a href="Nils%20Kristen%20Sandtr%C3%B8en">Nils Kristen Sandtrøen</a> (Ap); <a href="Lise%20Selnes">Lise Selnes</a> (Ap); <a href="Anette%20Trettebergstuen">Anette Trettebergstuen</a> (Ap); and <a href="Trygve%20Slagsvold%20Vedum">Trygve Slagsvold Vedum</a> (Sp).

1945.
Results of the <a href="1945%20Norwegian%20parliamentary%20election">1945 parliamentary election</a> held on 8 October 1945:
As the list alliance was entitled to more seats contesting as an alliance than it was contesting as individual parties, the distribution of seats was as list alliance votes. The Bp-H list alliance's additional seat was allocated to the Conservative Party.
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Kristian%20Fjeld">Kristian Fjeld</a> (Ap); <a href="Einar%20Frogner">Einar Frogner</a> (Bp); <a href="Arvid%20Johansen">Arvid Johansen</a> (Ap); <a href="Alv%20Kj%C3%B8s">Alv Kjøs</a> (H); <a href="Harald%20Johan%20L%C3%B8bak">Harald Johan Løbak</a> (Ap); <a href="Emil%20L%C3%B8vlien">Emil Løvlien</a> (K); and <a href="Johanne%20Samueline%20Pedersen">Johanne Samueline Pedersen</a> (Ap).

Vorum</a> (Ap).

1921.
Results of the <a href="1921%20Norwegian%20parliamentary%20election">1921 parliamentary election</a> held on 24 October 1921:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Thorbj%C3%B8rn%20Gj%C3%B8lstad">Thorbjørn Gjølstad</a> (H-FV); <a href="Johannes%20Johnsen%20Grue">Johannes Johnsen Grue</a> (V); <a href="Wollert%20Konow%20%28Hedemarken%20politician%29">Wollert Konow</a> (H-FV); <a href="Johan%20E.%20Mellbye">Johan E. Mellbye</a> (L); <a href="Oscar%20Nilssen">Oscar Nilssen</a> (Ap); <a href="Olav%20J%C3%B8rgen%20S%C3%A6ter">Olav Jørgen Sæter</a> (Ap); and <a href="Knut%20Sj%C3%B8li">Knut Sjøli</a> (Ap).
